alert.note: Alert for Eastern Sierra Slopes of Inyo County; Owens Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued April 03 at 12:50AM PDT until April 04 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM PDT TUESDAY... * WHAT..West winds 30 to 40 with gusts to 80 mph early this morning....shiting to the northwest during the day with gusts to 65 mph possible. * WHERE...Eastern Sierra Slopes and Owens Valley. * WHEN...Until 5 AM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong downslope winds have developed in the far western Owens Valley with several wind gusts of 60 to 75 mph west of Bishop reported. Strong downslope winds will remain possible through the overnight hours, mainly along and west of the US-395 corridor. Strong crosswinds likely which may overturn high profile vehicles.
info.instruction: Take action to secure trash cans, lawn furniture, and other lightweight fixtures and unsecured outdoor objects. Operators of motorcycles, vans, campers, trailers, and other high profile vehicles should be especially cautious for the possibility of sudden, strong crosswinds and be prepared for areas of blowing dust which could drastically reduce visibility.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Sierra Slopes of Inyo County; Owens Valley
